titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of Congress that the President should posthumously award the Presidential Medal of Freedom to Leroy Robert "Satchel" Paige.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

reference.label: text of measure as passed Senate

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Mr. LaTourette moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. Con. Res. 91.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 12/6/2006--Passed House without amendment. Urges the President to award the Presidential Medal of Freedom posthumously to Leroy "Satchel" Paige (the first Negro League player to be inducted into the Major League Baseball Hall of Fame) in honor of his distinguished baseball career and contributions to society.
